newsitem.title: USA: Mercury Finance closes Lyndon sale.
newsitem.headline: Mercury Finance closes Lyndon sale.

text.p: Mercury Finance Co said Wednesday it completed the regulatory approval process and closed on the sale of its Lyndon Insurance Group subsidiary to Frontier Insurance Group Inc for $92 million in cash.
As previously disclosed on April 23, the company will report a net book loss on the sale of $25 million.
Mercury acquired Lyndon in 1995 for $72.5 million and subsequently merged its other insurance operations with it.
Mercury said it will continue to offer insurance products to its consumer finance customers through arrangements that it has established with various insurers.
Separately, Mercury said work continues on the audit and restatement of prior years' financial results.

The process has been prolonged and made somewhat more complex by the need to reconcile and coordinate the analysis of the two auditing firms, Arthur Andersen LLP, for the 1996 accounting records, and KPMG Peat Marwick, for the earlier years, it added.
The company's estimate of shareholders' equity as of December 31, 1996, remains substantially in accordance with the previously estimated range of $138 million to $148 million, Mercury said.
